intro: Strobilanthes leucocephala, commonly known as the white-headed makepeace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white flowers that bloom in clusters at the top of the plant. The plant is herbaceous, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation.
